thread.title: Advocacy group drops lawsuit over Salt River wild horses
thread.title_full: Advocacy group drops lawsuit over Salt River wild horses

title: Advocacy group drops lawsuit over Salt River wild horses
text:
Advocacy group drops lawsuit against Forest Service over Salt River wild horse removal 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/21/15 11:31 am EDT - Updated: 10/21/15 11:31 am EDT 
PHOENIX â€” An Advocacy group that has worked to stop the U.S. Forest Service's plans to remove wild horses from along the Salt River has dropped its lawsuit against the agency. 
The Arizona Republic reports ( http://bit.ly/1Ro5T2Q ) that the Salt River Wild Horse Management Group filed a lawsuit after the Forest Service announced in July plans to remove nearly 100 horses. The lawsuit sought to stop the roundups and secure federal protection for the animals as "wild" horses. 
Under state law the Forest Service considers the horses "feral." 
The first part of the suit was dismissed by a judge after the Forest Service agreed to postpone any removals. The management group has dropped the second part of the suit without prejudice, which means they would refile in the future. 
Information from: The Arizona Republic, http://www.azcentral.com
